data.title: Auto indentation doesn't preserve space
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Copy a struct definition ("Ctrl+C")
2. Paste it inside a function
3. Ask VSCode to indent the structure definition inside the function : Ctrl+K Ctrl+F

As illustrated in the animation, after the indentation, the white spaces between the type and the name of a field is not preserve, and so the alignement of the field names inside the structure definition doesn't exist anymore.
![peek 11-05-2017 14-15](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1025244/25948925/0464a036-3656-11e7-8d20-b771204f1f6f.gif)

What I except  from VSCode indentation is just to add the correct number of white spaces at the beginning of each lines of the structure definition.

A solution may be to add a keyword in the setting to ask VSCode to not modify the ending of lines to indent.

data.title: Font size issue, seems to default to 72 dpi instead of 96 dpi

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: Fedora 26

Fonts in Visual Studio Code render much smaller than in any other application. In the attached screenshot, Visual Studio Code font size is set to 14 (default setting) and Gedit is set to size 11 (system default). Font hinting seems different too. I'm pretty sure Visual Studio Code uses a screen dpi setting of 72 (web standard) instead of 96 (desktop standard). I know that font rendering is done by Chromium, but maybe there is a way to at change the dpi setting. 

![vscode-font-rendering](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6661233/25948830/a98aef26-3655-11e7-8a3c-607a6623af06.png)

data.title: Research project on OSS motivation - would appreciate help for my master thesis
data.body:
**Dear OSS developer,**

I am a student at the Technical University Munich and I am currently collecting data for my master thesis to understand the motivations of OSS developer. I am interested in finding out what encourages you to give others feedback, to ask questions to the community, or even to produce high-quality software. I'd be really happy if you share your experiences with me and participate in my little survey. It will take you less than 10 minutes. You can find it under the following link: https://www.soscisurvey.de/OSS/?r=D

To say thank you, I will raffle three Amazon gift cards. All information will be treated strictly confidentially and anonymously. If you have any questions or comments, please feel free to contact me (corinna.schmidt@tum.de).

Many thanks in advance and all the best,

Corinna

data.title: ESlint extension stopped working and will not install
data.body:
_From @MrSkinny on May 8, 2017 19:48_

VSCode: 1.12.1

I noticed ESLint wasn't running in my project and went to the extensions tab. ESLint was no longer installed.  I searched for it on the marketplace but when I hit "Install", the button changes state for a second and immediately flicks back to "Install".  I am able to run/install other extensions.

Anyone else having this issue?

_Copied from original issue: Microsoft/vscode-eslint#235_

data.title: Implement a watch-dog mechanism which can kill runaway extension host processes
data.body:
In certain circumstances, e.g. extension that does `while (true)` loop, the extension host process will not terminate unless killed via task manager.

Implement a watch-dog mechanism that can kill runaway extension host processes.

NB: This was not an issue on Windows until we made the process be forked with the `detached`  option to allow 5s for the extensions to gracefully shut down.

data.title: Path issues with "did not receive lazyEnv in time"
Installer tries to close all applications and fails. Until Spotify.exe is closed.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.1 (f6868fce3eeb16663840eb82123369dec6077a9b, 2017-05-04T21:26:50.689Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.4|
|Go|lukehoban|0.6.61|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.11.0|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.9.0|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|1.0.0|
|erlang|pgourlain|0.1.0|
|RustyCode|saviorisdead|0.19.1|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Selecting 'Upgrade Now' when inside VSCode.
2. The upgrade app starts.
3. I get a popping window saying it is unable to close all running applications.
4. When clicking retry it just fails and says unable to close...
5. Then I start closing down apps (Outlook and Microsofty apps)
6. Still not working
7. Then I kill Spotify
8. And after that the retry succeeds and the installation progresses.

I speculate: Spotify is maybe a electron-based app as well and their co-existance was causing this?

data.title: Can i pass arguments to command in contributes block?
Code seems to only refresh imported d.ts on tab switch / file open
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: OSX El Capitan 10.11.6

I'm working on a file **MyFile.ts** that imports a definition **Library.d.ts** which is written by an external TypeScript compiler (**tsc -w**).
When I change something in **Library.ts**, then **tsc -w** will overwrite its **Library.d.ts**, but VS Code does not "update" its editor view of **MyFile.ts** automatically (in order to show errors) - it only updates it on events like tab switch or close/open (and thus the **Problems** tab in the bottom is also not getting updated).

Would it somehow be possible to "check" for changes in background?

data.title: Hard hang while editing regular expression
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.0-insider 2017-05-09...
- OS Version: Windows 8.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Edit a file with text in it
2. Open find, enable regular expressions, and enter: ^(.*)+

The editor will now hard-hang, there is no timeout failure, I had to reload when got the prompt to do so.

While I know that the above expression is nonsense - it just happened to be something I entered after deleting a couple of characters before the +. 

It shouldn't cause a hard-hang like this - at worst it should timeout itself, not wait for the electron to handle it at the application level.

data.title: [C++ on windows]Unable to start debugging. Could not load file or assembly 'Newtonsoft.Json, Version=6.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=30ad4fe6b2a6aeed' or one of its dependencies.
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

 

- VSCode Version:1.12.1
-  OS Version: Window10 X64
-  Cpptools: [\\cpvsbuild\Drops\MDDDebugger\CppTools\20170510.3\Extension\cpptools.vsix](\\cpvsbuild\Drops\MDDDebugger\CppTools\20170510.3\Extension\cpptools.vsix)
- GDB: [C:\cygwin64\bin\gdb.exe](C:\cygwin64\bin\gdb.exe)


Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open tests folder in attachments directly. 
[tests.zip](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/992021/tests.zip)
2. Update "program" and "miDebuggerPath" in launch.json as following:
        "program": "${workspaceRoot}/a.exe",
        "miDebuggerPath": "C:\\cygwin64\\bin\\gdb.exe",
3. Set a breakpoint at line of 7 in a.cpp file.
4. Press F5 to start debugging.

Excepted:
It can debug normally and hit the breakpoint.

Actual:
It pop up a error message:
![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20922638/25935835/90809ede-3657-11e7-94de-c85c8b2a315d.PNG)

Investigation:
1. You can refer to more details in attachment.
[log.txt](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/992052/log.txt)
2. This issue reproduce c++ automation many cases on windows.
![1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20922638/25936049/80268fb6-3658-11e7-89dc-f21c5d633a9c.PNG)
3. When use attach to debug, It also can reproduce.
4. This issue can not reproduce on Linux.

data.title: Cursor goes to end of line on saving
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.1 (1.12.1)
- OS Version: El Capitan 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Edit any file with content
1. Hit the save command or wait for autosave delay if it's the case
1. Cursor jumps to EOL. In cases of low autosave delay (when using file watchers for example), it'll close intellisense and/or ruin your coding experience

Autosave example:

![2017-05-11 08_08_28](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8936090/25934982/151fcc8c-3621-11e7-933b-f086d778acee.gif)

data.title: regression: caret is rendered in wrong position when editor zoomed
data.body:
this is a regression. this did not happen in 11.1

- VSCode Version: 12.1
- OS Version: XUbuntu 16.04.2 LTS (lxde) 

Steps to Reproduce:
 - full-screen VS code
 - View->Reset Zoom
 - create a new file
 - type 100 characters on a single line (not enough to make it wrap)
 - move the caret to end of line
 - View->Zoom Out
 - type some more characters

NOTE: the caret is no longer rendered at the end of the line, and the new characters, while they appear at the end of the line, do not appear where the caret is.

 - View->Reset Zoom
 - View->Zoom In (5 times)

NOTE: different zoom levels affects the positioning error in different ways. zooming out tends to make the caret jump left & right more and more. zooming in yields a subtler error, but still makes it impossible to use as a text editor.

data.title: Merge pull request #1 from Microsoft/master
data.body: Pull

data.title: Timeout (always) exceeded when running tests on Travis
Preserve Webview Scroll Position
data.body:
Fixes #22995

**Bug**
If you switch away from an editor that users a webview, the scroll position is currently not preserved. This effects our release notes and the markdown preview. The root cause is that the webview is disposed of when the view is hidden.

**Fix**
Add some presisted state to track scrollProgress through the webview. Use this state in the standard html editor and in the release notes.


**TODO**
- [ ] Make sure html preview handles case where content changes. I believe this should reset the scroll position
- [X] Handle dragging editor tab to create duplicate view. This should also copy over the scroll position

data.title: The `Open Changes` button not displayed as disabled for files without any changes

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

VSCode Version: 1.12.1
OS Version: OS X EI Capitan 10.11.3

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open some project from GitHub.
2. Open a file A.cs which has no fresh changes at all.
3. Stay on the editor of A.cs, and notice the button of `Open Changes` on the top right corner above the editor doesn't display as disbled! Clicking it has no effect of course, but it should display as disable in this case just like what in the old versions.
